intro: Lorostelma venezolanum, commonly known as the Venezuelan lorostelma, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
